articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukraine used U.S. ATACMS missiles to strike Russian territory for the first time, Moscow said, in a major escalation on the war's 1,000th day.
articles.title: Ukraine hits Russia with US missiles for first time on war's 1,000th day

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hundreds queued on Tuesday outside a Hong Kong court ahead of the sentencing of 45 pro-democracy activists in a landmark national security trial that has damaged the city's once feisty pro-democracy movement and drawn international criticism.
articles.title: Hundreds queue for sentencing of 47 Hong Kong democrats

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Intensifying efforts for a truce in Lebanon have brought into focus the role of the country's army, which would be expected to keep the south free of Hezbollah weapons but is neither willing nor able to confront the Iran-backed group, seven sources said.
articles.title: As truce talks progress, Lebanon's army cornered by politics, funding

articles.author: Jake Spring, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies meet on Tuesday to discuss sustainable development and the transition to cleaner energy, as they aim to increase the odds of a successful deal to address global warming at U.N. climate talks in Azerbaijan.
articles.title: G20 leaders turn focus to climate change on Rio summit's last day

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Fighters from Hamas and other Gaza factions have formed an armed force to prevent gangs pillaging aid convoys in the embattled territory, residents and sources close to the group said, after a big increase in the looting of scarce supplies.
articles.title: Hamas-led force targets gangs looting Gaza aid convoys

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Hamas attack on Israel that triggered the Gaza war has stirred debate among the enclave's Palestinian clerics, with some saying it was not worth the heavy civilian death toll and others declaring the Oct. 7, 2023 assault was a Muslim duty.
articles.title: Hamas attack on Israel stirs controversy among Gaza clerics

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: A senior U.S. official said on Tuesday there was a "real opportunity" to end the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah and that gaps were narrowing, signalling progress in Washington's efforts to clinch a ceasefire agreement.
articles.title: US envoy says end to Israel-Hezbollah war 'within our grasp'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Groups of European countries agreed on Tuesday to work together to develop missile defence, electronic warfare and other military assets as part of a drive to foster closer defence cooperation between national governments.
articles.title: EU nations team up to develop air defence, other weapons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Africa will use its G20 presidency to focus on advancing inclusive economic growth, food security and artificial intelligence, President Cyril Ramaphosa said on Tuesday at a summit of the Group of 20 major economies in Brazil.
articles.title: South Africa will focus G20 presidency on inclusive growth, food security

articles.author: Jonathan Saul
articles.description: When darkness descends on Metula, Tamira Lang, one of the Israeli border town's last remaining residents, switches off her house lights to avoid detection by Lebanese group Hezbollah, whose fighters sit a few kilometres away.
articles.title: Last Israelis in bombed out Metula hope for Lebanon ceasefire to rebuild lives
